fields.name: Full-Time Employees
fields.description: Full-time employees work a standard number of hours per week (usually 40 hours) and receive benefits such as health insurance, paid time off, and retirement plans.

fields.name: Part-Time Employees
fields.description: Part-time employees work fewer hours than full-time employees, often on a fixed schedule. They may or may not receive benefits, depending on company policies.

fields.name: Contract Workers
fields.description: Contract workers are hired for a specific project or duration. They work on a temporary basis and are not considered permanent employees.

fields.name: Temporary Employees
fields.description: Temporary employees are hired to cover short-term needs, such as seasonal work or employee absences. They may work full-time or part-time.

fields.name: Interns
fields.description: Interns are typically students or recent graduates who work for a limited period to gain practical experience in their field.

fields.name: Freelancers/Independent Contractors
fields.description: Freelancers or independent contractors work on a project-by-project basis. They are self-employed and provide services to the company.

fields.name: Consultants
fields.description: Consultants are experts in a specific field who provide specialized advice or services to the organization. They may work independently or as part of a consulting firm.

fields.name: Seasonal Workers
fields.description: Seasonal workers are hired during peak seasons (e.g., holidays, summer) to handle increased workload.

fields.name: Remote/Telecommuting Employees
fields.description: Remote employees work from locations outside the company's physical office. They communicate and collaborate virtually.

fields.name: Shift Workers
fields.description: Shift workers follow rotating schedules (e.g., day shift, night shift) to ensure continuous operations.
